titleStmt.title: T. P. Linthicum et al. to Unknown
CWG7184

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Nelson County State of Kentucky respectfully represent to you, that Henry Turner who is Now in the Penitentiary at Frankfort in this state, has been there about Two Months under sentence from the Milatary Commission and Commander of this Department

The said Turner is the son of a most estimable widow, residing in our Midst he was industrious and aided greatly in support of his Mother, he is a youth about 19 years of age, and bore an excellent character, before he was seduced into association with the Guerrillas, and we hope and believe that if he should be discharged from Confinement, that he will return to the paths of Virtue and be a good Citizen We therefore ask the Clemency and generosity of the Government in his behalf, and humbly pray forgiveness and pardon for him, as in duty we will every pray &c October 2nd 1865

T P Linthicum
James, M, M, Conn, Maj, 6 Ky Cav
H. W. McCown
T, H, Samuels Sheriff, N C
A. C. Thomas Deputy. S.
Dent S. Pash
